page.title: 12THE WOODYARD
page.content: The woodyard in Church Lane has been running as a family firm for 70 years. Five men work there .They obtain trees from {Longleat,}parks in Bath or other woods. The trees used are Beech, Ash, Pine,Elm and Oak. Soft wood is used for fencing and housing etc.. The hard woods go for{pit props, rail supports {and building.}Coal comes from Nottingham and the same lorry takes the props back - about 32 tons of wood per month. Anthracite comes from South Wales. Any wood which cannot be used or sold is cut up for firewood. There is a huge bandsaw powered by a diesel engine. The blade is 27 feet long. A slow moving table pushes the trees to the blade. Each blade only lasts a day then it has to be sent away for sharpening.
